text.section: The State Superintendent shall be appointed by the State Board for a term of 4 years beginning on July 1 after his appointment and serves until a successor is appointed and qualifies.
The State Board shall fix his salary and pay it from the appropriation for the expenses and maintenance of the Department.

section.section: Before removing the State Superintendent, the State Board shall send the Superintendent a copy of the charges against him and give him an opportunity within 10 days to request a hearing.

If the State Superintendent requests a hearing within the 10-day period:
The State Board promptly shall hold a hearing, but a hearing may not be set within 10 days after the State Board sends the State Superintendent a notice of the hearing; and
The State Superintendent shall have an opportunity to be heard publicly before the State Board in his own defense, in person or by counsel.

text.section: The State Board shall appoint a new State Superintendent to fill a vacancy in that office for the remainder of the unexpired term.
